Hi Adriano.
Yes, interesting catch. The guideline may misguide to one of th=
e options you mention, that I dislike a lot: URL Templates. That makes the =
server lose control of the URL space, as it it is forced to follow a strict=
 construction that also exposes resource information.

I may make a differe=
nce between a resource Identifier and a simple entity identifier. The resou=
rce identifier is always the URL, that may change over time. We create a re=
source using an entity (pure information) and it is stored somewhere and a =
URI is assigned to it. If you have the entity id like the UUID, the only ho=
pe you have is searching the web space for a resource that may be represent=
ing it. You can have more than one, actually, and there should be a way in =
the app to get to it (searching is the normal option here).

So, the questi=
ons is not about the client finding the URL structure, but of the client fi=
nding the search service. Say, we can have a link in the welcome page that =
says "Find item by ID". Simple.

William Martinez.
